Then I had some vinegar and cauterized her throat with it; this was for the addition of treatment. And then I wandered around and did not know what God would do next regarding that situation.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter xxxvii.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	On incising an abscessed armpit.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When there is a discharge from the armpit, and it is abscessed and long, it is then called perpendicular; and if it is below thick and round, it is then called a bubo.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	However, when it is cured by what we have mentioned in the division and does not conform to your treatment, and also sometimes an abscess remains inside but is subtle, then you should incise the one that is aggregated and round; and if it reaches a certain length and is bloody, of dark color or black, and does not respond at the center, then you should attempt the incision cautiously, for there is fear of malignancy in such cases.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see it according to the method I have described regarding its whiteness and length, make the patient lie down with their arm raised using an instrument that fits the shape of the area, and then press it firmly. Then pull it downwards and incise it with one of two instruments mentioned in the double incision procedure.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And you should not incise it beyond what is appropriate within the natural limits without excess, for if you incise too much, you will harm the patient.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And after the incision, use what we have recommended in the double incision procedure, and care for it until it is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, if the patient is distressed by the incision, you should use cautery without fear, and the method of cauterization involves only sharp water. Place the head of the patient on your lap, then press it firmly with the instrument we have mentioned. Then take the sharp water that we described in the chapter on cauterization and apply it to the area, making sure not to make it too thick or thin, and fill the concavity of the instrument which has this shape:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Here is the extract of the cautery in which the medicine is placed as with the cautery of copper alloy, and place the instrument with the medicine on the wound, and the patient lies on his back so that saliva or mucus from the mouth does not fall onto it due to its proximity, lest it should cause harm to that part.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then take the medicine and apply it to the uvula for a short period until you see it become blackened and numb from the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take a cork and wrap it around the end of the cautery, and dip the cork into the medicine, and insert the cautery with the cork into a tube so that the cork adheres to that tube, and do this as many times until you achieve what you desire from the cauterization of the wound, and then leave it until it dries and falls off after three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you need to repeat the medicine, do so, and then after the cauterization clean around the wound with a cork dipped in syrup, and modify it with what is around the wound from the medicine, and wash it with fresh water, and treat it externally with an embrocation, and care for it with remedies until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this kind of treatment is safer than incision and longer in duration out of caution.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	In some cases, the uvula is cured with something that is less harsh than cauterization and incision, as it is treated with sublimation in this manner: take camphor, hyssop, oregano, rue, Arabian saffron, chamomile, and similar herbs, and mix all these ingredients or some of them in a pot, and immerse them in sour wine, and boil; the pot should be heated moderately, and in the middle of the pot place a tray upon which is placed an instrument made of wire like this: it should be made of silver or wire.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And let the extremity be inserted into the mouth of the patient until the vapor reaches the uvula above which the uvula is obscured.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then proceed with it on those moist areas until they are dry, and be careful not to perform this treatment at the beginning of the occurrence of abscesses, for it would be too harsh on the abscess, and you should not do this, but rather wait for the maturation of the abscess.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if you do not have this instrument at hand, now take a cane and attach to the end of it a piece of cloth dipped in vinegar, so that the mouth of the patient is protected, for the cloth dipped in vinegar prevents the steam from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXXVIII.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of spines and of what adheres in the wound and of other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Moist substances adhering to the wound or thorn or some other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then you should remove what is apparent from those substances, on which your eye rests, and then press the tongue with an instrument in front of sunlight, so that it becomes clear to you what is in the wound.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And what does not appear and is hidden in the wound, you should make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, for the cause attached to the wound will be easily expelled by vomiting; or have the patient swallow a piece of bread or lettuce seed or a mouthful of dry bread; or take a piece of dried sea sponge and soak it well in vinegar, then let the patient swallow that, as when it reaches the place where spines are lodged, they will be easily expelled.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	Take one eel and boil it in vinegar, then remove its intestines and extract the contents; or take a poultice and apply the contents to it and spread it on.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	If you do not forget the causes which we have mentioned, now use an instrument of lead according to this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And let it be as thick as a small finger, and at its end let there be a curve which you insert into its throat with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And when you act, keep his head raised up, and be careful not to touch the bone of his throat, so that it does not injure him or the person who is holding him, or cause harm to the surgeon’s hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	However, let the patient be well prepared, because of his knowledge of the location of the cause attached and held down, and pull his hand with the instrument up, all this according to the amount that is prepared within him so that it is not forgotten.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XXXIX.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the extraction of a bloodsucker attached to the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When treating a bloodsucker with what we have said in the division of treatment with medicines and not compresses, now consider the patient's throat in the sunlight, since you have already drawn his tongue forward with the instrument that we recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Then if you see the bloodsucker, extract it gently with a small incision or with fine tweezers.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible for you to remove it then, now take a concave cannula and insert it into the patient's throat, and immediately place a heated iron in the concavity of the cannula, and do this as many times (until the bloodsucker is dead and falls off the throat) and keep the patient from water for the entire day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	Take a sponge full of clean water and wipe the mouth with it, then rinse the mouth with that water; and do not let any impurity enter from there, and pour out the water after an hour or so when the blood has settled.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not possible to do as we have recommended with this, then fumigate the malodor with cypress or with sweet basil using the instrument which we have recommended for the fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, and he will be cured.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And there is another method of operation in fumigation for this, which is that you take an olive in which are burning coals and the olive is covered with a cover in the middle of which is a hole, and attach the end of the instrument to that hole; then proceed with the fumigation from above; and place the patient's mouth on the end of the tube, and close their mouth so that the fumigation does not escape until you know that the fumigation has reached the blood, for the blood will fall immediately.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not work, then repeat the fumigation as many times as necessary, and abstain the patient from drinking water, and give salty and dry foods, and let them not drink water; and it is also necessary that they follow this regimen strictly.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which blood is drawn from the gum when it is seen; and it resembles forceps as you might see them, but with some curvature:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed in the gum, and the end of it resembles the beak of a heron, which is sharpened with a file, so that when it grasps something, it does not let go.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the speech on the preparation for abscesses and their incision.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are various types, of many ways, as will be recalled, each in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they differ in their puncture and incision by two methods, of which one is according to the nature of the abscess itself; and by what they derive from the humidity.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second method is according to the locations where they occur in the body, for an abscess occurring in the head is different from one occurring in the buttocks; and an abscess occurring in fleshy parts is different from one occurring at a joint; and each has its treatment by surgical operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And there are some abscesses that should not be punctured but only at the proper time of maturation of the pus or when they are fully developed.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	There are other abscesses that should be evacuated when they are crosswise and not mature according to their development, such as abscesses near joints, because when an abscess is close to a joint, its nature extends until you can puncture what is around it, and lightly the ligaments or nerves of that joint may be corrupted, causing contraction of that limb; or if it is next to a principal member, delaying its puncture could lead to damage to the main member; or if it is near the buttocks, then puncture it before it becomes mature; but do not puncture it raw and without proper digestion, except for those close to the buttocks, so that you do not cause premature discharge of pus inside the buttocks, leading to an elongation and forming a fistula, or causing damage before it can heal.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	You know that you should pierce the abscess when it is ripe.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you know that it is ripe when there is a reduction in pain and the cessation of fever, and shortly after, a decrease in swelling and pulse, and the sharpness at the head of the abscess, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And you should know that the puncture should be made at a place where the pus is closest to the surface of the abscess and from where it will come out easily during healing.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the puncture should always be made along the length of the skin or body if the abscesses are in parts such as the chest, elbows, tendons, cords of nerves, arteries; and finally, in all places equally where there is no reflection; for in those that do reflect, use a puncture according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is in a fleshy area, the best time to make the puncture is after the digestion of the second stage has been confirmed, as we have said; for if you pierce it before that, it will prolong the illness of the patient and cause much harm, and greatly harden the lips of the abscess and its depth.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some abscesses should be punctured across the grain of the skin or body due to necessity, or according to what is required by the member.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you should administer a small puncture, and in large abscesses, a larger puncture or multiple sections according to the diversity of the size of the abscesses.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And other abscesses in which the incision should be hollowed and made when it is to be done as with bread, and it is done at a time when it can already stand, just like those that occur with excessive boils and buboes.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those that are cut open having three angles; and of those in which it is cut open as the figure of a myrtle leaf, just like the abscesses of the armpits.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of those in which round incision and lunar incision are administered, and similar to these.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But in the one that does not have any such as its superficial lion abscesses, you should pierce it with a superficial puncture, or just plane it.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the abscess is large and has already collected pus, you should pierce it but do not hesitate to extract all the pus at that moment; having extracted one part from it, then scrape the abscess internally on another day, and then extract a larger portion, and continue doing this several times according to its progression until it heals.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is a robust man, or a pregnant woman, or an infant, or an elderly person in frailty, for in such cases the vital spirit is quickly resolved through the evacuation of the pus, and the patient easily recovers, and you will have operated successfully.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Therefore, guard this chapter with great caution, and when you perform the incision in which you pierce these abscesses, make sure to clean the wounds and then consider whether the wound of the abscess is small or requires a flat incision; if it is small, administer some lint or antiseptic cotton. If the abscess is large and the incisions are many, then you should place dry lint in each tract until they heal.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess a part of the cord is cut or has been hollowed out along its circumference, then you should fill it with old cloth or thread made from linen, as when you have treated ulcers or swellings without moisture; and strengthen it on the third day; and subsequently proceed to treat it according to what is needed from ointments until it heals.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	If blood flows during the time of your operation, then prepare water and vinegar in which you dip a cloth, and place that over the area where the blood is flowing for several times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	If the bleeding continues, then you should administer treatment and care, using powders which I have recommended in various places of this our book and in division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	If it is in the time of winter, and the site of the abscess is on many nerves, then you should apply powders mixed with vinegar and heated oil, and place those on the sites.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in summer, and the sites are fleshy, then you should apply powders soaked in water and oil or in vinegar and oil, and this should be wiped on for three days as we have said, and then you should open the abscess, cleanse it, and administer to its cure what it needs until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary for the knowledge of the treatment of abscesses generally, but according to the method of distinction I have already said about every abscess in what manner is the way of its cure separately by chapters.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter XLIV.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	On the section of abscesses that appear on the neck.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	On the neck of the head, small abscesses appear, and they are of various types of nodes that contain membranes; and their types vary.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And they are soft, and the contents of these are moist, similar to jelly.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	Of those things which contain humidity like dust, and similar to them; and of those things which are lithic, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all, and in the extraction of those there is no fear, as you should know that the extraction of those does not oppose the curvature.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in the section of those is that you should press them with an instrument whose form approaches this, which is called an entrodes, so that you know what it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what it contains is humidity, then you should divide that with a section along its length by a superficial section according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin in the section from line .B. to line .G. Therefore, when the humidity is evacuated, you should then excise that skin which contains the humidity, and do not leave any cause for recurrence, as closely observed tumors return if any cause remains.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then immerse a piece of cloth in Egyptian ointment if it is available, and if not, in water and salt; and apply it to the wound and leave it there for another day, as this will corrode everything that remains of that membrane.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then apply the cloth to the ointment again, a second and third time if necessary, until you are confident that there is no remaining cause of that membrane; now treat the wound with an ointment until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if an abscess contains hard nodes, then you should incise that according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	with a section having the shape of a cross, and insert once between the two lips of the incision and scrape it thoroughly from all sides, and exert your skill in extracting the membrane that contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	If there is opposition from your surgeon, now do what I have recounted first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly treat the mature abscess by incision and cure as we have told you; and the incision of a mature abscess is easier, since it contains little blood and little moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes there are cases of abscesses in the head in certain people who are not very moist; the cause is that I once incised an abscess on the head of an old woman and found it as hard as a stone, rough, white, which could not be penetrated, and if anyone were to attempt to treat it that way, they would suffer harm.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	However, in other abscesses that occur in the head, this is not the case of this chapter; also, the abscesses that appear on the heads of children and behind the ears should be treated with superficial incisions.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And pause the incision of those in the lower part so that the contents of the abscess can drain into the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And then treat those as is appropriate for that type of cure.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter XLII.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the incision of scrofulas which occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Often these abscesses occur in the neck and armpits; and sometimes they appear in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck often develop between the muscles, and every scrofula of these is within its own proper layer, just as with knots and abscesses of the head, as we have recounted.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	There are various types of these scrofulas, and they are spots. Of those, only some are lithic, and of those, only the ones containing moisture are subject to treatment, and among them are malignant ones which do not respond to cure.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, when you encounter one that is in good condition during the examination, whose color matches that of the gland and which is not adhered to any part, nor attached to the neck nerves or veins, and is not swollen, cut it with dry scissors superficially above the upper line of .G. between the line of .B., and scrape it completely from both sides of the gland as we have said about abscesses of the head, and remove it little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more careful that the vein or nerve not be cut.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And let the scraping not be sharp, so as not to harm you during cutting or disturb the patient, and do not cut what is not necessary; for if you were to cut a vein or artery and stop your operation, then apply green vitriol powder or other powders that promote blood flow and staunch the wound. Let it rest inside where the abscess subsides, and when the inflammation is mollified and begins to become purulent, proceed accordingly.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood has been constricted.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore, return to your operation once you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inquire at the time of the operation if there is any cause for other small scrofulas, so cut those and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is in the root of the scrofula a large vein, cut at the hour when you do not injure that scrofula from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	And cut so that the seam is very strong and let it be such that it falls by itself without harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound with old cloth which you have already soaked in Egyptian oil, and then treat that.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you cut out that scrofula entirely, then sew together the two lips of the wound and close it up so quickly that there is no time for any superfluity.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is excessive superfluity due to the size of the scrofula, then cut into its root and extract it, apply sutures, and do as has been said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for the scrofulas that contain humidity, pierce it with a superficial incision where the place of maturation appears to you, and proceed with an incision that reaches the deepest part of the mass, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then proceed with the incision, apply ointment and treatments suitable for those cases, so that it accelerates what remains of the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And when you see the wound already cleaned, then treat it with ointment of flesh-generating properties until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XLIII.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	On the incision of the pustule of an accidental abscess in the groin.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients called this section in the epitome, and no one in our land has seen that operation performed.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the speech of those people.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	In men who have a squint, it is advisable to avoid the extraction of the epilhot, as by doing this no benefit will be gained since all the veins and the major ones in the affected area are not reached.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	In those who have boils in the mouth or throat or near the ears, when the illness is not in the bone, it is better to use the section of epilhot to avoid the loss which is caused by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want to do this, we should incise the epilhot below three circles of its circles, or four if it is a small section across two circles in quantity. The section should be made in soft tissue, not in cartilage, and this place is suitable for cutting because it is devoid of flesh and the blood vessels there are few.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the surgeon is cautious, it is better to first extend the throat skin by one inch and then cut into the canal, but avoid the blood vessels if you see any reason to do so.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then incise the soft tissue as we have recommended; and it is significant for the section of the canal by the membrane which is attached to that part and by the absence of voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And let the wound be left open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, when the time is feared for perforation, bring together two edges of the wound's skin, and close it up except where it is near the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	Here is the translation:
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Al-bucasis says that the summary of the speech which we have recounted is an exposition, namely that one sees that some of these abscesses have obstructed the throat of the patient, and the patient has come within reach of death, and the airway is cut off, and some go to incise the epiglottis so that the patient may breathe over the site of the wound by some respiration, and he may be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for this commander allows the incision to remain open so that the poison inside may be consumed by the disease; and it is the poison of him for three days; and therefore at that time commands such an incision, and treats it internally until he is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen with my own eyes is that a servant took a knife and inserted it into her throat and cut out part of the windpipe, and I was called to treat her, and I heard the moaning as if it were the groan of one near death, and uncovered the wound and saw the blood which had come from the wound in small amounts.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, I confessed that she had not cut any vein or artery, and air was coming out of the wound, and I treated her internally until she was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And the servant did not suffer any harm except for hoarseness in her voice, and after some days she returned to improvement in her condition.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the section on the epiglottis there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the section on abscesses that occur in the throat externally, and it is called a throat hernia.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This swelling called groin hernia is a large swelling according to the color of the body, and it occurs in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it happens in two ways, either naturally or accidentally.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural case, there is no need for treatment.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental one happens in two ways; one of which is similar to fatty knots, and the other way is like a swelling caused by an arterial clot, and in that case there is cause for concern.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And it is not appropriate to treat it with iron unless it is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you should proceed with caution and investigate it as mentioned. If you find it similar to fatty knots and not attached to any veins, then you incise it like you would knots and extract it with water containing soap and bursericlam; otherwise, thoroughly examine its nature, and subsequently treat the area with what is appropriate for treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter XLV.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On the Section of Kinds of Knots.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are various kinds of knots, and I have already mentioned all their kinds in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And it is necessary for me to describe the difference between a knot and an exitus as would cause doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore, I say that in an exitus there is heat and fever and intense pain until the boiling of the superfluity subsides; and it completes putrefaction at which point the fever, pain, and heat cease.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	This may not be a heat nor fever nor pain, and it continues like a lion's leap which is to its prey.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body, and the beginning of it is like a pustule and it is made thus as it vacates, whether larger or smaller, and its kinds are two, either dry or greasy and containing moisture, and the colors of the moisture are motley, as I say in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you arrive at the treatment of this condition, express it and inquire about it at the beginning concerning the disturbance which is called an intermisson, as its form will come in the chapter which is near to this one.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And it is the method of inquiry into abscesses and all nodes, and it is that you take this disturbance and insert it in the place most humid which you find in the abscess, and you will revolve it there little by little until you know that the disturbance has already penetrated the tissue.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And finally withdraw it according to the measure of the size of the abscess, and then extract the disturbance and consider what has come out in its wake.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the flowing moisture, of whatever color it may be, is found, then you shall incise it with a superficial section as I have said regarding other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if from the wake of the disturbance you do not find moisture, then you shall know that it is dry.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And if it is dry, make an incision in the form of a cross according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	as I have taught you, and suspend it with threads, and incise the tissue from all sides easily, and preserve the skin or sac, if possible, over that and extract the pus from the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	If the vein is cut during the operation, it is not possible to extract that one, and you must seal it with stitches so that nothing may remain inside from which infection might arise.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	If anything remains inside for any reason, whether little or much, the wound will return according to the vein.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that something small remains inside, then apply the wound with some corrosive sharp powders and treat the wound, and place on it what will form an abscess cauterized, and cure it by another method until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if the wound is large, then you should stitch both sides of it and treat it with what promotes healing.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	If the vein is either pulsating or non-pulsating and in opposition, then you should cauterize it and fill the site with three applications of vitriol, letting that rest for two days or three until the wound subsides and the bleeding ceases; and afterward return to separate what was cut from the wound.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter XLVI.

E so de tres especias, quar de lor es gran, migier e pauc.	It consists of three types, for among them is one great, middle, and small.

Conveneysso que sian per aquels apostemas e exituras e fistulas e bubos per so que entre aquelas so dels osses e de autras causas.	It is suitable for them to treat abscesses, excrescences, fistulas, and buboes, as well as other conditions related to the bones and various causes.
E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.	They make needles, large and thick, as well as large needles used to sew leather, which are made of citrus thorns, or of wood, or of iron, or of silver. And the best ones are those made of citrus thorns.
E son faytz les experient de plum negre, les quals se acordan que per aquels sian ubertas las fistulas en la conquavitat de las quals so reflexios, que sian reflectidas am la sua levitat am aquelas refleccios.	The experts make black feather probes, which they use to probe fistulas in the concavities of which there are reflections, so that they can be reflected by their lightness on those reflections.
E so de tres specias, quar alcus de lor so loncs, e dels autres migiers, e dels autres breus, segon la quantitat del ample de la fistula e de la strictura de lu.	They are of three types, for some of them are long, and others are middle-sized, and the others are short, depending on the quantity of the width of the fistula and the narrowness of it.

The forms of the lancets are of many species, for among them are some simple ones, which have only one curvature, and there are three kinds: large, small, and medium.
E de lor so uncis orps, e so de tres specias.	And of their curved ones there are hooks, and they are of three kinds.
E de aquels so uncis haventz doas curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And among those with curves there are ones having two curvatures, and they are of three kinds.
E de lor so haventz tres curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And of those that have three curvatures, there are three kinds.
E totz aquetz so necessaris en lor loc.	And all of these are necessary in their place.

And these are the forms of the knives with which nodes and abscesses are incised and scraped; they are of three kinds: one is large, another medium, and a few others.

Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	The extremities of those with which incision is made are sharp, and the other extremities are not sharp; they are not designed in such a way to pause, but rather so that during the scraping of nodes there is no fear of cutting a vein or nerve. And by this means, the patient may be healed quickly after the abscess has been scraped, finding some relief due to the adjustment following the incision of the abscess.
E aquestas son las formas de almagidas, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc, ayssi cum veyras.	And these are the forms of forceps, and they are of three kinds: large, medium, and small, as you will see.

Sian faytas de eram e so semblantz de ray am le qual e fayt alcofol.	They are made of iron and resemble a reed from which alcohol is made.
E es en la extramitat lada punctada am spatum occultada e en aquela corr a las partidas dedintz e defora, quan tu vols, ayssi cum veses.	And there is a punctured extremity on the side where the spatula is hidden, and along that edge are the parts inside and outside, as you can see when you want to.
Las formas de spatimis, les quals so amaguatz entre los ditz deves la perforacio dels apostemas e no les percebo les malautes, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc.	The forms of spatulas, which are hidden between the fingers during the puncture of abscesses so that the patient does not perceive them; they are of three kinds: large, medium, and small.

Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	They are made from citrus peel, round with some length, and they are delicate.
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	And you should have these types of flaps, large, medium, and small, because with them you can ligate blood flow quickly when necessary, and also at other times when there is no immediate need for medication.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	However, do not use them to ligate blood in all parts of the body, but only in fleshy areas such as the thighs and sides of the body, and on the muscles of the arms, and on the breasts and abdomen and similar fleshy parts.
E alcunas veguadas son faytz de aquels strumentz autres petitz semblantz scorsas de fisacs segon aquesta forma; per les quals lo sanc es abscindit quan es fayt per fleubotomia, o deves inscizio de vena o de arceria.	And at times, some are made of other small instruments resembling the shape of fish scales; with which blood is ligated when performed for phlebotomy or incision of a vein or artery.
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	And at times, some are made round in this form:
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter XLVII.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	On the treatment of men's breasts that are similar to women's.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	In some cases, men's breasts become enlarged when they begin to sweat during sleep, and then the breasts resemble those of women, and we call this condition Roman apostemata, which is rare.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And for that which you are to treat in this manner, cut it into a crescent-shaped section according to this form, from the line of B to the line of G, and then shave off all the roughness, and then fill the wound with flesh-growing medicine, and then sew together the two edges of the wound, and care for it until it is healed.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	If the breast inclines to the sides and is softened because of its size as it often does in women, then cut it into two parts with its excess pus, each part resembling a crescent-shaped section, each contained within the other except for their ends, such that the larger line contains the smaller one according to this form from the line B to the line G. Then shave off the edge between the two lips of the wound, remove the fatness, and administer what we have said about suturing and powders necessary for healing until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the incision of what needs to be cut due to the patient's discomfort and blood flow, then fill the wound with cloth submerged in a corrosive liquid and leave it until that corrodes what remains of the fat, and then care for it until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter XLVIII.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	On the Incision of Abscesses That Occur Near the Armpit.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These abscesses that occur near the armpit are often of the type of scrofula, hard, and they contain a hair-like substance.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And only some of these contain moisture; those that contain moisture should be cut in a crescent shape according to this figure: from the line G to the line B. And when everything has been evacuated from the abscess, you then fill it with thick cloth and leave it until the next day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	Let the cut be treated and cared for with an appropriate ointment until it is healed.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the abscess is of the type of the glands or scrofula, then you should incise it in the manner described in the section on scrofula as well.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	If the plague has spread to the point of gangrene, then administer cauterization as we have previously described.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter XLIX.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the incision of abscesses that occur due to arteries or veins.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is ruptured and the part above it becomes inflamed, an abscess may occur. The signs by which one can determine whether inflammation and abscess are due to an artery or a vein: for when the abscess is due to an artery, it tends to aggregate in the upper part of the body; and if you press on the abscess with your fingers, you will hear a hissing sound in it.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And when it is due to a vein, it appears near the surface of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	The incision of this abscess is risky, especially in areas such as the armpits, angles, neck, and other parts of the body; it is dangerous, so its treatment should be avoided, and particularly so if it occurs in the extremities or on the head.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But for an abscess caused by inflammation of the artery opening, incise it in its proper section lengthwise; then carefully open the section with hooks near the artery, and separate the tunics until it is exposed.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	Upon that needle I place something and make it penetrate into the other side, and tie the artery with double thread in two places, which cause I explain in the extraction of two arteries, which are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then place the location between two ligatures with a spatum inside so that the blood stops there until it is all dissolved and the abscess is resolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer treatment in which pus is generated so that the ligatures fall off; and afterward, treat it with appropriate remedies so that it heals.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is an abscess due to the section of a vein, then you should hold with your hand what is within reach concerning the abscess and its condition, and then insert the needle below the place where you have held with your hand, and make it penetrate; and tie a double thread in such a way that you extract it from the other side, and afterward ligate the abscess with a good ligature as I have told you regarding the grapevine ligature on both sides of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that the thread will be extracted, then insert the thread with the needle below all of the abscess beyond the insertion of the first needle, and tie the threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the abscess in its proper place so that when what is inside it comes out, you then incise the excess of the vessel, and leave what is connected to it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then apply powder on which you have soaked in vinegar and oil, and afterward administer the treatment with bandages and remedies so that it heals.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter on abscesses which occur due to nerve strain.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as abscesses occur in arteries and veins, so too do abscesses occur in nerves when they are struck or due to excessive labor, and similarly.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it happens that this occurs in the areas of the joints or the heel, or in any place where the joints are frequently troubled.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	It is a severe abscess and resembles the color of the surrounding tissue. It is one of its worst conditions when it is hard and accompanied by vehemence, and at that time the patient appears in a state similar to stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an abscess that aggregates at the front of the body, and because of this it is less severe, and it affects all parts equally without going to the parts in front or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, when it is in the joints, it should not be treated with iron, for it would easily lead to contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But when it is in the head or on the forehead, treatment should be done with spatum.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if the abscess is small, then at this time treat it with forceps and incise it carefully.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if it is large, then suspend it with ligatures, and excise it, and afterward close the wound; and adjust the wound with stitches, and care for it until it heals.
Capitol .li.	Chapter II.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	On the section of abscesses which occur due to pain in the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Thus, for some persons, swellings occur in their bellies and in other parts of their bodies which are called fungi because they resemble mushrooms; the root of these is delicate and their head is thick. And often the lips of these are smooth, and it is of those that are small, and it is of those whose magnificence is great.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I myself have seen one, and in his belly there were two parts which resembled mushrooms more closely, and there was no difference between those white ones with their delicate roots.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the lips of those were turned outward and split open, and moisture flowed from them all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, I incised them and found within one weighing about eighteen uncias and the other weighing about six uncias.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the procedure in incising them is that you consider whether the malady is humid, and if the color of the tumor is white, humid, with delicate roots; then you incise it with a broad scalpel, and immediately in your presence cauterize it over fire, for the moisture and swelling must be expelled by drying up the blood; and if there is much bleeding, cauterize that.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you find the malady rare and fearful, guard against incising with an iron instrument; rather, take fresh lead, apply it to that tumor in the manner we have described; and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And immediately adjust the tightness of the lead band; therefore, do not stop applying the lead continuously until it is detached and falls off by itself.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	If there is a thick pus in the wound, at that moment when making the incision into it there is some cause for fear and dread, especially if it is in the abdomen.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	It is possible that you may incise half of it, and then cauterize that so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then treat it internally until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And be careful not to presume to incise pus that is of a dark color, with little sensation, and hard in consistency, for that is usually cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And this will come as a reminder regarding these matters.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the treatment of an umbilical hernia.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	An umbilical hernia is caused by various reasons; it may be due to fissures in the abdominal wall above the belly, and through these openings, either tissue or intestines protrude as in other ruptures; or it can be caused by blood that flows from a vein or artery depending on what is present there; or by trapped air.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	However, if it is due to a fissure in the abdominal wall and the protrusion of tissue, then the color of the swelling is similar to the color of the skin; it is soft without pain, and may appear in various positions.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is due to the protrusion of the intestine, then its appearance differs greatly from what we have described, and when you press on it with your fingers, it retreats and then returns; it is soft to the touch, and becomes more prominent after bathing and vigorous work.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	Meats that are moist, when pressed with your hand, do not remain hidden, nor are they constricted, nor are they hard.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is due to inflammation, then these signs appear: the abscess turns to a declining blackness.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	Meat that is badly grown results in a severe, large, and hard abscess, which penetrates according to the amount.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	If it is due to gas, then the touch of it is light.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation in this case is that you consider whether the prominence of the navel is due to inflammation of an artery, or a vein, or gas; then it is advisable for you to be cautious about treating it, since there is fear and dread as I have taught you in the chapter where I mentioned abscesses from arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the prominence of the navel is due to the bowel or membrane, then it is advisable for you to command the patient to lie on their back and extend themselves; then examine around the entire navel with your hand, and then instruct them to stand between your hands on their back; then encircle the area with a piece of linen in the circumference of the navel where you have felt with your hand; and then extend half of the abscess above about an inch; and then tie it in the circumference tightly with strong thread or string according to the proper method.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.
